line.label: Line Chart
line.description: A line chart is a way of plotting data points on a line. Often, it is used to show trend data, or the comparison of two data sets.

bar.label: Bar Chart
bar.description: A bar chart provides a way of showing data values represented as vertical bars. It is sometimes used to show trend data, and the comparison of multiple data sets side by side.

doughnut.label: Doughnut Chart
doughnut.description:
Pie and doughnut charts are probably the most commonly used charts. They are divided into segments, the arc of each segment shows the proportional value of each piece of data. They are excellent at showing the relational proportions between data.
Pie and doughnut charts are effectively the same class in Chart.js, but have one different default value - their cutout. This equates to what portion of the inner should be cut out. This defaults to 0 for pie charts, and '50%' for doughnuts.

am_doughnut.label: Doughnut Chart
am_doughnut.description:
Pie and doughnut charts are probably the most commonly used charts. They are divided into segments, the arc of each segment shows the proportional value of each piece of data. They are excellent at showing the relational proportions between data.
Pie and doughnut charts are effectively the same class in Chart.js, but have one different default value - their cutout. This equates to what portion of the inner should be cut out. This defaults to 0 for pie charts, and '50%' for doughnuts.

linearea.label: Line Area Chart
linearea.description: Both line and radar charts support a fill option on the dataset object which can be used to create space between two datasets or a dataset and a boundary, i.e. the scale origin, start, or end (see filling modes).

scatter.label: Scatter Chart
scatter.description: Scatter charts are based on basic line charts with the x axis changed to a linear axis. To use a scatter chart, data must be passed as objects containing X and Y properties.

horizontalbar.label: Horizontal Bar Chart
horizontalbar.description: A horizontal bar chart is a variation on a vertical bar chart. It is sometimes used to show trend data, and the comparison of multiple data sets side by side. To achieve this you will have to set the indexAxis property in the options object to 'y'. The default for this property is 'x' and thus will show vertical bars.

D3_circular.label: D3 circular packing Chart
D3_circular.description: A circular packing chart displays a hierarchical dataset as a set of nested circles. Nodes are displayed as circles. Size is usually proportional to a numeric variable.

gauge.label: Gauge Chart
gauge.description: A gauge chart is a type of data visualization often used to display a single data value with a quantitative context.

force_directed.label: Force Directed Chart
force_directed.description: A circular packing chart displays a hierarchical dataset as a set of nested circles. Nodes are displayed as circles. Size is usually proportional to a numeric variable.
